head.title: Lynn Schug, Edward Van Buren IV

identified-content.person: SCHUG, LYNN MARIE (LYNN MARIE VAN BUREN)

hedline.hl1: Lynn Schug, Edward Van Buren IV

block.p: Lynn Marie Schug, a daughter of Sharon M. Schug and Gerald F. Schug of Eau Claire, Wis., was married yesterday to Lt. Edward Morris Van Buren IV, the son of Marguerite M. Van Buren of New York and the late Mr. Van Buren III. The Rev. Joseph R. Johnson performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Luke in St. Paul.

Mrs. Van Buren, 29, is an associate in the Washington office of Baker Botts, a law firm, and a master's degree candidate in international studies at George Washington University. She graduated from St. Norbert College and received her law degree from the University of Wisconsin at Madison. Her father is a communications instructor at the Chippewa Valley Technical College, and her mother teaches seventh- and eighth-grade English and literature at Regis Middle School. Both schools are in Eau Claire.

Lynn Marie Schug, a daughter of Sharon M. Schug and Gerald F. Schug of Eau Claire, Wis., was married yesterday to Lt. Edward Morris Van Buren IV, the son of Marguerite M. Van Buren of New York and the late Mr. Van Buren III. The Rev. Joseph R. Johnson performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Luke in St. Paul.

Mrs. Van Buren, 29, is an associate in the Washington office of Baker Botts, a law firm, and a master's degree candidate in international studies at George Washington University. She graduated from St. Norbert College and received her law degree from the University of Wisconsin at Madison. Her father is a communications instructor at the Chippewa Valley Technical College, and her mother teaches seventh- and eighth-grade English and literature at Regis Middle School. Both schools are in Eau Claire.

Lieutenant Van Buren, also 29, is now a Navy submarine officer assigned to the Naval Reserve Officers Training Corps unit at George Washington University, where he is both an assistant professor of naval science and a candidate for an M.B.A. In August, he is to become a consultant at American Management Systems, a consulting concern in Fairfax, Va. He graduated from the Naval Academy and received a master's degree in aerospace engineering from the University of Maryland at College Park. His mother retired from the New York office of the Reader's Digest Association, where she was an international media research associate in the magazine's advertising department. His father was an independent insurance broker in New York.
The bridegroom is a descendant of Lewis Morris, a signer of the Declaration of Independence, and a distant relation of Martin Van Buren, the eighth president of the United States.
